text: Jan Cornelis Terlouw (15 November 1931 - 16 May 2025) was a Dutch politician, physicist and writer. He was a member of the Democrats 66 (D66) party. Terlouw was born in Kamperveen, Netherlands. He was the Deputy Prime Minister and at the same time the Minister of Economic Affairs from 1981 to 1982 during the Dries van Agt cabinet. A children's writer, his best known work is Winter in Wartime (Oorlogswinter, 1972). Terlouw died in Twello, Netherlands on 16 May 2025, at the age of 93. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2025 deaths Category:Democrats 66 politicians Category:Deputy Prime Ministers of the Netherlands Category:Dutch children's writers Category:Dutch former Christians Category:Dutch physicists Category:Dutch provincial politicians Category:Leaders of political parties in the Netherlands Category:Members of the House of Representatives of the Netherlands Category:Members of the Senate of the Netherlands Category:Government ministers of the Netherlands Category:Nuclear physicists Category:People from Kampen Category:Politicians from Overijssel Category:Writers from Overijssel
